title: Cristiano Ronaldo , Kylian Mbappe have this in common
body_text:
April 20, 2024
Cristiano Ronaldo's former Real Madrid teammate Casemiro has recently revealed a trait that makes the Portuguese football legend and French footballer so alike.
Casemiro, the Brazilian footballer who now plays for Manchester United, previously played alongside Ronaldo for several years during their respective spells at the Santiago Bernabeu, Sports Illustrated reported,
In a recent interview with El Chiringuito, he revealed how Mbappe, the Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) superstar, compares to the Portugal international.
"Mbappe reminds me of Cristiano. He's on the field, he's smelling a goal," Casemiro said. "You have to be worried with this guy because he will score a goal. Cristiano was like that."
Mbappe's PSG contract expires at the end of the 2023/24 season and he is widely expected to join Madrid on a free transfer on lucrative personal terms.
With 284 goals in 374 club games, the 25-year-old footballer is PSG's all-time leading scorer with 253 goals, 53 clear of second-place Edinson Cavani.
Mbappe is set to join Los Blancos later this summer.
His final game for PSG could yet come against his likely future employers, with both sides through to the semi-finals of this season's Champions League.
Les Parisiens have been drawn with Borussia Dortmund, while Madrid will take on Bayern Munich.
The 39-year-old former Manchester United star, Ronaldo, who has been cited as Mbappe's idol, joined Madrid in 2009 for a then-world record Â£80 million fee.
He scored 450 goals for the club, more than any other player in their history. He was also a key contributor to 15 trophies and won four of his five Ballons d'Or during his time in the Spanish capital.
